home.summary: Howdy! I'm a software developer from Phoenix, Arizona, and this is my portfolio website.
home.bio:
I was born and raised in Lima, Peru. At the age of 16, I moved to the United States to pursue a college career. Since my English skills were weak, I spent my first year studying English. Learning English as a young adult was not easy, but it taught me to be patient and perseverant.

During my college career, I used to build websites as a hobby. Then in 2009, I got my first part-time job as a web developer, at Arizona State University. Six months later, I was offered full-time employment. The day I got this promotion was one of my happiest days.

jobs.title: Systems Analyst Senior
jobs.description: I was responsible for bringing my team up to speed with modern web development best practices such as using a package manager (e.g. Composer), adopting GitHub flow, and working locally with Docker. I also implemented new features and provided ongoing support for a large LMS website known as Research Academy.

jobs.title: Drupal Lead
jobs.description: I was responsible for mentoring my team about Drupal best practices and leading the development of all Drupal projects. I also got hands-on experience using Drupal 8, Salesforce API, Google Maps API, Git Flow, Jira, Confluence.

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.description: I was responsible for creating new features and providing support for Drupal and WordPres websites. Two large projects I worked on as a backend developer were Marriot's Meetings Imagined and Charles Schwab's Insights & Ideas.

jobs.title: Front-End Drupal Developer
jobs.description: I spent most of my time converting static breakouts into functional dynamic pages powered by Drupal 7. I also had the opportunity to use the GreenSock library to build an animated infographic.

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.description: Kaluma was a Drupal shop. I was primarily writing custom modules and providing Drupal support for the retainer clients. I also learned how to use libraries for handling PDF files such as WKHTMLtoPDF and PHP-PDFTK.

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.description: Goteq was a SEO company. At first, I  was primarily maintaining an in-house inventory software written in PHP and MySQL. Then I used my Drupal skills to build a dashboard app. I also got some exposure to Cake PHP, Facebook API, and Google Analytics API.

jobs.title: Web Site Specialist
jobs.description: This was my first Drupal development job. I learned how to write Drupal modules and themes. I also provided Drupal support for multiple university websites.

projects.name: RSVP Manager
projects.description: This app allows you to view, search, add, edit and remove people from a guest list.
